bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing sshd from using the 'setcap' accesses on a process.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: While mounting to dirrectory in users home using sshfs as normal user I get this AVC.
User has got encrypted home using ecryptfs. SELinux is preventing sshd from using the 'setcap' accesses on a process.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that sshd should be allowed setcap access on processes labeled sshd_t by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'sshd' --raw | audit2allow -M my-sshd # semodule -X 300 -i my-sshd.pp
Additional Information: Source Context system_u:system_r:sshd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 Target Context system_u:system_r:sshd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 Target Objects Unknown [ process ] Source sshd Source Path sshd Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.8.fc24.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Enforcing Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.6.4-301.fc24.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 12 11:50:00 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 1 First Seen 2016-08-10 09:30:31 CEST Last Seen 2016-08-10 09:30:31 CEST Local ID 8e6d2bae-f0c3-4556-a6eb-8f898749be9a
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1470814231.20:355): avc: denied { setcap } for pid=30551 comm="sshd" scontext=system_u:system_r:sshd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tcontext=system_u:system_r:sshd_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tclass=process permissive=0
Hash: sshd,sshd_t,sshd_t,process,setcap
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.8.fc24.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.6.4-301.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport

$ sesearch -A -s sshd_t -c process | grep setcap allow sshd_t sshd_t : process { fork sigchld sigkill sigstop signull signal getsched setsched getcap setcap setexec setrlimit setcurrent setkeycreate } ;
$ rpm -q selinux-policy selinux-policy-3.13.1-191.10.fc24.noarch
